intro: Linaria langei, commonly known as the Lange's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows from 10 to 30 centimeters in height, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Linaria langei is often found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, where it plays a role in stabilizing the local ecosystem.
